text: Sort of. I am working for Julia Computing full-time on <http://Pumas.ai|Pumas.ai> projects and products and we use Optim.jl a lot. So if there are any issues you can be quite sure they'll be fixed (subject to my time constraint not being violated of course :slightly_smiling_face: ) and I am also almost done with a full rewrite of the internals which you can find in NLSolvers.jl (it's registered already). Eventually, Optim will call the code that exists in that package. It should have better support for things such as GPU programming and special array (StaticArrays for example) and number types.  It's fun getting your gradient norm down to 1e-200 with DoubleFloats.jl for example :smile:
